;什么是 SEO 报告？

;

;SEO 报告显示您的内容和网页在搜索引擎中的表现以及潜在客户的表现如何与您的内容互动。

;

;搜索引擎优化 (SEO) 旨在扩大公司在自然搜索结果中的知名度。因此，这些努力吸引了更多访问者访问公司网站，增加了他们获得更多转化的机会并带来更多收入。

;

;现在您知道什么是 SEO，但如何知道您正在做这件事正确的？这就是 SEO 报告的用武之地。它可以让您跟踪网站的性能、SEO 策略的成功之处以及需要改进的地方。

;

;您可以跟踪不同的指标，例如搜索排名引擎结果页面 (SERP)、登陆页面访问量、点击率和目标关键字。

;

;SEO 报告有哪些好处？

;

;;

;

;1.您将了解您的 SEO 策略是否有效。

;

;您可能有一个想要排名的关键字列表，但这还不够。您需要测试并查看您定位的短语是否确实会带来流量。

;

;SEO 报告可让您了解您的 SEO 策略是否有效。您是否输给了针对相同关键字的竞争对手？您是否错过了任何可以增加流量的目标？

;

;批判性地审视您的 SEO 计划可以帮助您确定是否存在您应该拥有的关键字或空白并围绕其构建计划。

;

;报告的结果使您能够根据需要进行调整。您还可以进行实验，看看什么可以帮助您提高排名。

;

;2.您可以衡量您的表现。

;

;SEO 报告收集重要指标，包括自然流量、跳出率、平均会话持续时间和转化率。这些指标可帮助您衡量内容的有效性以及网站上的用户体验。

;

;您将能够做出数据驱动的决策，以提高参与度并推动更多转化。

; < h4>;3。您可以识别技术 SEO 挑战。;

;SEO 不仅仅是写出正确的文字。网站的技术方面会严重影响您在搜索中的显示位置。

;

;如果您的网站具有正确的结构（例如正确编码的导航栏和正确使用标题），搜索引擎就可以轻松抓取您的内容。< /p>;

;这些机器人将了解您的网站的内容并确定您的相关性，从而使您的排名高于竞争对手。

;

;SEO 报告可以帮助您确定网站的基础设施需要改进的地方。这包括如何提高页面加载速度、死链接对您造成的影响，以及移动设备上的响应能力。

;

;4.您可以跟踪竞争对手。

;

;SEO 报告通常包含将您的表现与竞争对手进行比较的部分。您将看到竞争对手赢得了哪些关键字。然后，您可以确定您的方法，以便取得领先地位。

;

;例如，您的文章可能排名低于竞争对手，因为您的版本错过了关键部分。您可以添加这些内容以保持竞争力。

;

;您将确定适合竞争对手的策略，并将类似的策略应用到您自己的 SEO 策略中。

;

;5.您可以评估策略的投资回报率 (ROI)。

;

;许多营销人员在他们的 SEO 策略上投入资金。

;

;您可以投放按点击付费 (PPC) 广告系列或其他广告提高您的搜索排名。您的 SEO 报告将显示这些广告是否导致流量增加。这可以帮助您充分利用营销预算。

;

;

;

;标题和摘要

;

;无论您是以幻灯片还是 PDF 形式呈现 SEO 报告，您都需要标题和摘要。如果您正在从事特定项目或企业的一个分支机构，请在您的项目名称中包含该信息。

;

;请务必提及您预先运行报告的具体时间段。这可以是月份、季度或年份的名称。

;

;亮点

;

;您的 SEO 报告将包含大量数据。您的团队可以参考表格和图表来深入了解您的进度。

;

;本节相反，可帮助您综合表现中的显着趋势。这是您最重要发现的摘要。

;

;在您的亮点部分中，注明以下内容：

;
    ;
  • ;您最重要的两个或三个 SEO 指标以及您的衡量方式.
    • ;
  • ;您的团队在特定时期内擅长哪些方面。
    • ;
  • ;您已完成的最大的 SEO 相关任务。
    • ;
  • ;您的团队在哪些方面表现不佳以及原因.
    • ;
;

;高级领导者应该能够浏览此部分并了解报告的其余部分将涵盖的内容。

;

;

;

;此部分不需要多个图表。我们稍后会显示该信息。

;

;

;

    • ;

;网站概述

;

;SEO 报告的这一部分涵盖您网站的整体性能。您的概述应涵盖以下内容：

;
    ;
  • ;;域权限。 ;该指标反映了您网站域的整体实力。它的衡量范围为 1 到 100。指向您网站的反向链接的质量和数量会影响此指标。较高的域名权重通常意味着您在搜索中的排名较高。
    • ;
  • ;;索引状态。;这是指哪些网站页面包含在搜索引擎索引中。您将知道搜索引擎是否已抓取您网站的内容并为其建立索引。如果某些页面未编入索引，可能会影响其可见性和自然搜索流量。
    • ;
  • ;;页面权威;，衡量网站上各个页面的强度。它评估特定页面在搜索结果中排名靠前的可能性。页面权威度受到内部和外部链接、内容质量和相关性等因素的影响。
      ;
    • ;如果您的网站上有多个中心页面，您将需要评估每个页面的权限。例如，如果我正在评估此网站，我会查看营销、服务、网站和销售博客的页面权限。

;关键字分析< /h3>;

;本节重点关注关键字排名。您的团队在给予期间的目标是什么？你表现如何？此部分可能包括有关效果最佳的关键字和关键字趋势的数据。

;

;您的受众应该了解您的效果是提高还是下降。添加箭头、红/绿颜色编码或 +/- 符号可以让您轻松理解数据。

;流量分析

;

;SEO 报告的流量分析部分可帮助确定有多少人访问您的网站网站以及他们到达该网站后采取的操作。

;

;您需要包含网站的总体流量以及这些访问者的来源。您可以为有机流量和无机流量创建两个部分。

;

;有机流量

;

;有机流量是指通过免费搜索引擎结果登陆您网站的访问者。

;

;这些人通过 Google、Bing、Yahoo 或口碑找到您。通过了解自然流量，您将了解通过内容定位关键字的成功程度。

;

;自然流量

;

;无机流量也称为付费流量或非自然流量。有机流量。这是指通过付费广告活动登陆您网站的访问者。

;

;它包括各种付费渠道产生的流量，例如搜索引擎广告（按点击付费广告）、展示广告、社交媒体广告、联属网络营销和电子邮件营销。

;

;对于这两种类型的流量，您需要记下总体流量、流量来自何处以及用户在您的网站上执行的操作。请注意您的访问者跳出率、平均会话长度和转化率。

;

;反向链接概述

;

;反向链接是外部来源上的链接，可将用户引导至您的网站。当一个网站链接到您的网站时，它本质上是对您内容的可信度、相关性或质量的保证。

;

;反向链接被认为是 Google 等搜索引擎的关键排名因素。

;

;假设您在网上销售最好的猫刷，并且数百个宠物护理网站链接您的产品。 Google 知道您销售的产品值得信赖，并且在猫美容方面拥有很高的权威。

;

;因为您提供了有价值的东西，所以您的排名会更高。

;

;但是，如果您的灌木丛只是在垃圾邮件网站上链接，您的权威将受到打击。此部分评估指向您网站的反向链接的质量和数量。

;

;它可能包括有关引用域、锚文本、链接多样性以及可能对您的 SEO 产生负面影响的任何有毒或垃圾邮件反向链接的信息。< /p>;

;如果您有任何链接建设活动，请在此处包含您的表现。

;

;技术 SEO 概述

;

;正如我们上面所讨论的，您网站的技术基础设施帮助搜索引擎确定您涵盖的内容。拥有正确的标题结构、快速加载时间和辅助功能有助于提高 SEO 性能。

;

;;

;

;

;在本节中，您将注意到您的网站在哪些方面遇到了困难，以及如何改进这些技术方面。在准备过程中评估以下内容：

;
    ;
  • ;;网站的可抓取性。 ;分析搜索引擎是否有效访问网站页面。查找可能阻碍抓取的任何问题，例如被阻止的页面、不完整的 robots.txt 文件或使用“nofollow”标签。
    • ;
  • ;;网站速度。;加载缓慢的页面可能会导致抓取速度缓慢。对用户体验和搜索引擎排名产生负面影响。使用 Google PageSpeed Insights 或 GTmetrix 等工具评估您网站的速度并识别任何性能瓶颈。
    • ;
  • ;;多媒体优化。;大图像或不正确的文件类型可能会导致您的网站加载缓慢，影响你的排名。您还需要为图像正确命名并添加替代文本，以便抓取工具能够理解图像中的内容。
    • ;
  • ;;网址结构。;检查网站网址的结构。确保它们具有描述性、简洁，并遵循 SEO 友好的做法，例如使用相关关键字。
    • ;
  • ;;无效链接。 ;识别并修复网站上任何损坏的链接。损坏的链接会对用户体验产生负面影响，并损害您网站的可信度。

;让我们深入探讨如何为您的企业制定影响者营销策略。该策略将使您能够管理与影响者关系的各个方面。它还将确保他们成功帮助您实现广告系列目标。

;;1.确定您的活动目标。;

;

;在制定影响者营销 SMART 目标时，需要记住三个因素：影响范围、相关性和共鸣。这些将帮助您将目标集中在影响者营销的不同方面。

  • ;;相关性;是您的受众与您的产品之间的联系程度由于影响者的工作而获得的品牌、产品或服务 - 它将帮助您提高品牌忠诚度。例如，如果您的受众看到他们喜爱和钦佩的名人使用您的产品，他们可能会感到与该产品有很强的联系。

  • ;;共鸣;是指将受众群体吸引到特定目标的能力。因影响者的内容而采取的行动——这一切都与影响力和记忆力有关。共鸣可以帮助您增加关注者数量、增加网站流量并提高转化率。例如，如果您的受众阅读了由影响者撰写的有关您产品的博客文章，他们可能会点击博客文章中的链接，将他们引导至您的网站，以便他们可以购买该产品。

;<强>;2.定义您的营销活动受众群体。;

;

;在推进影响者营销策略之前，请与您的营销团队合作制定和实施了解您的买家角色。

;

;这将帮助您确定您所追求的客户的确切类型，从而帮助您确定哪种影响者和内容最能吸引他们，以确保您的目标受众与影响者的受众一致。

;;3.设置预算并选择影响者类型。;

;

;根据我们对六种主要影响者类型的审查，您应该能够确定哪种类型最适合您的业务目标和目标受众。从那里，您可以开始制定预算。

;

;例如，如果您是一家预算较低的初创公司，您可能会选择与小网红合作。如果您是一家拥有更多资源的中型公司，您可能会决定聘请名人影响者或与在行业中备受推崇的 KOL 合作。

;

;HubSpot 博客研究发现，营销人员通常支付以下费用：纳米影响者、微观影响者和宏观影响者的预算为 501 美元和 1 万美元，其中 1 万美元以上的预算为大多数超级影响者保留。

;

;根据调查，大约 90% 的营销人员有影响者营销预算， 45% 的分配在 10 万美元到 50 万美元之间。

;4.熟悉 FTC 指南

;

;是的，有指南，您必须遵守这些指南以确保您的品牌、声誉和合法性。联邦贸易委员会制定了防止虚假广告和诈骗等问题的规则。

;

;其中一条规则是影响者不能隐藏与他们认可的品牌的“物质联系”。还必须明确内容是广告还是真实帖子。

;

;例如，如果有影响力的人碰巧找到了他们真正喜欢的香水并决定在他们的平台上谈论它，则可能不算数如果他们与该品牌没有达成协议，则可以作为广告。

;

;但是，如果该品牌向影响者付费以讨论和认可其香水，则影响者需要声明该内容是广告。这就是为什么一些影响者在他们的帖子中使用“#Ad”。

;发布低质量或非原创内容。

;通过专注于制作具有视觉吸引力且独特的内容，为受众提供价值，您可以提高参与度、扩大影响力并在 Instagram 上培养对您品牌的积极看法。

;但在我们了解这个强大过程的每一步之前，让我们先回顾一下理性决策到底是什么以及为什么它很重要。

;

;

;

;理性决策是一项重要技能，尤其是在数字营销行业。人类本质上是情绪化的，因此我们的偏见和信念可能会模糊我们对现实的感知。幸运的是，数据使我们的观点更加清晰。通过向我们展示受众实际上如何与我们的品牌互动，数据使我们不再依赖假设来确定受众喜欢我们的哪些方面。

; 1.验证并定义您的问题。

;

;要证明您确实存在问题，您需要证据。大多数营销人员认为数据是灵丹妙药，可以诊断我们策略中的任何问题，但实际上您需要从数据中提取见解来证明任何事情。如果不这样做，您只是查看电子表格中的一堆数字。

;

;要查明您的具体问题，请从您需要的领域收集尽可能多的数据并进行分析以发现任何令人担忧的问题模式或趋势。

;

;示例：

;

;“分析我们的博客流量报告后，我们现在知道为什么我们的流量在过去一年中趋于稳定 - 我们的自然流量逐月略有增加，但我们的电子邮件和社交流量减少了。”

;

;2.研究并集思广益解决您的问题的可能解决方案。

;

;扩大潜在解决方案库可以提高解决问题的机会。为了找到尽可能多的潜在解决方案，您应该从自己的知识和互联网中收集有关您的问题的大量信息。您还可以与其他人一起集思广益，发现更多可能的解决方案。

;

;示例：

;

;;潜在解决方案 1：;“我们可以同时专注于增长自然流量、电子邮件和社交流量。”

;

;;潜在解决方案 2：;“我们可以同时关注电子邮件和社交流量的增长 - 自然流量已经逐月增加，而电子邮件和社交流量却在减少。”

;

;;潜在的解决方案3：;“我们可以只专注于增加社交流量——增加社交流量比同时增加电子邮件和自然流量更容易。我们在 Facebook 上也有 200 万粉丝，因此我们可以将我们的帖子推送给大量读者。”

;

;;潜在解决方案 4：; “我们可以只专注于增加电子邮件流量——增加电子邮件流量比同时增加社交流量和自然流量更容易。我们还拥有 250,000 名博客订阅者，因此我们可以将我们的帖子推送给大量读者。”

;

;;潜在解决方案 5：;“我们可以只专注于增加有机流量——增加有机流量比同时增加社交和电子邮件流量更容易。我们还刚刚实施了支柱集群模型来提高我们域的权威，这样我们就可以吸引大量来自 Google 的读者。”

;

;3. 为您的潜在解决方案设定成功和失败的标准。

;

;设置一个阈值来衡量解决方案的成功和失败，可以让您确定哪些解决方案可以真正解决您的问题。不过，您的成功标准不应该太高。您永远无法找到解决方案。但如果您的标准切合实际、可量化且针对性强，您就能够找到一个标准。

;

;示例：

;

;“如果我们的某个解决方案将我们的总流量增加了 10% ，我们应该将其视为克服流量瓶颈的实用方法。”

;

;4. 充实每个解决方案的潜在结果。

;

;接下来，您应该确定每个解决方案的潜在结果。后果。为此，请为每个替代方案创建一个优缺点表，并将它们相互比较。您还应该在列表中按照从解决问题的最佳机会到最坏机会的顺序排列解决方案的优先级。

;

;示例：

;

;;潜在结果 2：;“电子邮件和社交媒体不断增长同时增加流量会略微增加整体流量 - 两个渠道仅占我们总流量的 20%。”

;

;;潜在结果 3：;

;;潜在结果 4：;“通过每天发送两封电子邮件来增加电子邮件流量我们的博客订阅者面临着挑战，因为我们已经每天向订阅者发送一封电子邮件，而该频道仅占我们博客流量的 15%。专注于电子邮件只会产生最小的结果。”

;

;;潜在结果 5：;“通过针对所有电子邮件的高搜索量关键字来增加自然流量我们的新帖子是增加博客整体流量的最简单方法。我们有很高的域名权重，Google 引用了我们总流量的 80%，而且我们刚刚实现了支柱集群模型。专注于有机会产生最大的成果。”

;

;5.选择最佳解决方案并进行测试。

;

;根据对潜在解决方案的评估，选择最佳解决方案并进行测试。您也可以在此阶段开始监控初步结果。

;

;示例：

;

;“对我们来说，关注自然流量似乎是最有效、最现实的策略。让我们测试纯有机策略，我们只创建具有当前或潜在搜索量并适合我们的支柱集群模型的新内容。”

;

;6.跟踪并分析您的测试结果。

;

;跟踪并分析您的结果，看看您的解决方案是否真正解决了您的问题。

;

;示例：

;

;“经过一段时间后，测试一个月后，我们的博客流量增加了 14%，自然流量增加了 21%。”

;

;7.实施解决方案或测试新的解决方案。

;

;如果您的潜在解决方案通过了测试并解决了您的问题，那么这是您可以做出的最理性的决定。您应该实施它来彻底解决您当前的问题或将来的任何其他相关问题。如果该解决方案未能解决您的问题，请测试您提出的另一个潜在解决方案。

;

;示例：

;

;“仅关注有机产品的结果超出了我们的成功门槛。从现在开始，我们将转向纯有机战略，我们将只创建具有当前或未来搜索量并适合我们的支柱集群模型的新博客内容。”

;

;避免偏见理性的决策过程

;

;作为人类，我们的情绪自然会接管你的决策过程。没关系。有时，感性的决定比逻辑性的决定更好。但当你确实需要优先考虑逻辑而非情感时，用理性决策模型武装你的大脑可以帮助你抑制情感偏见并尽可能客观。

;How to Publish an Ebook

;

;Publishing an ebook can be a great way to share your message or content with a wider audience. Here's a step-by-step guide on how to publish an ebook:

;

;1. Convert to eBook Format

;

;Converting your ebook to the appropriate format is necessary to ensure compatibility with your readers and their devices. It allows you to incorporate responsive design elements and preserve the layout of your book. It provides a consistent reading experience across various devices, ultimately increasing the reach and accessibility of your ebook.

; ;;

;What ebook file format should you use?

;

;Ebooks can be saved in one of ;several formats.; Depending on your end-user, though, you might find a use for any of the following file types:

;
;PDF
;

;PDFs are likely the most well-known file type. The “PDF” extension stands for “Portable Document Format,” and is best for ebooks that are meant to be read on a computer (digital marketers, you'll want to remember this one).

;
;EPUB
;

;This file type stands for “Electronic Publication,” and is a more flexible ebook format. By that, I mean EPUB ebooks can “reflow” their text to adapt to various mobile devices and tablets, allowing the ebook's text to move on and off different pages based on the device's size on which a user is reading the ebook. They're particularly helpful for viewing on ;smaller screens;, such as smartphones and the ;Nook; from Barnes and Noble.

;
;MOBI
;

;The MOBI format originated from the Mobipocket Reader software, which was purchased by Amazon in 2005 but was later shut down in 2016. However, the MOBI file extension remains a popular ebook format compatible across the major e-readers (except the Nook).

;

;While the format has some limitations, such as not supporting audio or video, it supports DRM, which protects copyrighted material from being copied for distribution or viewed illegally.

;

;Newer Kindle formats are based on the original MOBI file types.

;
;AZW
;

;This is an ebook file type designed for the ;Kindle;, an e-reader device by Amazon. However, users can also open this file format on smartphones, tablets, and computers through the Kindle app.

;
;ODF
;

;ODF stands for OpenDocument Format, a file type meant primarily for OpenOffice, a series of open-source content creation programs similar to Microsoft Office.

;
;IBA
;

;IBA is the proprietary ebook format for the Apple iBooks Author app. This format does support video, sound, images, and interactive elements, but it is only used for books written in iBooks. It is not compatible with other e-readers.

;

;2. Choose a Publishing Platform

;

;When choosing a platform, consider factors like reach, royalty rates, distribution channels, ease of use, and the preferences of your target audience. It may also be worth exploring regional or specialized platforms depending on your ebook's niche or target market.

;

;Here are some popular options:

;

;Amazon Kindle Direct Publishing (KDP)

;

;;KDP; is one of the most popular self-publishing platforms. It allows you to publish and sell your ebook on the Kindle Store, accessible by millions of Kindle e-readers and Kindle apps. KDP offers various promotional tools and provides global distribution options.

;

;Apple Books

;

;;Apple Books; (formerly iBooks) is the ebook platform for Apple devices, including iPhones, iPads, and macOS devices. It provides a seamless reading experience and allows you to publish and sell your ebook on the Apple Books store.

;

;Barnes & Noble Press

;

;;Barnes & Noble Press; (formerly Nook Press) is the self-publishing platform for Barnes & Noble, one of the largest booksellers in the United States. It allows you to publish and sell your ebook on the Barnes & Noble website and Nook devices.

;

;Kobo Writing Life

;

;;Kobo Writing Life; is an ebook self-publishing platform associated with Kobo e-readers and apps. It offers global distribution and the ability to set pricing, promotions, and earn royalties from sales.

;

;Draft2Digital

;

;;Draft2Digital; is a user-friendly ebook distribution platform that helps you publish and distribute your ebook to multiple retailers, such as Amazon, Apple Books, Kobo, Barnes & Noble, and more. It simplifies the process by handling the conversion, distribution, and payment aspects for you.

;

;3. Create an Account and Upload Your Ebook

;

;Sign up for an account on your chosen platform. Provide the necessary information, such as your name, address, and payment details if required.

;

;Once your account is created, follow the platform's instructions to upload your ebook file and cover design. Ensure that the files meet the platform's formatting and size requirements.

;

;You'll also need to fill out the book details, including title, author name, description, and categories or genres. These details help readers discover and understand your ebook.

;

;4. Set Pricing and Royalties

;

;Determine the pricing for your ebook. This determines how much revenue you can generate from each sale. By setting the right price, you can ensure your ebook is competitive in the market while maximizing your earnings.

;

;Once you have your price set, you'll want to ;determine your royalty rates;, which is the percentage of the ebook's price that you earn as the author or publisher for each sale.

;

;Different ebook publishing platforms offer various royalty structures, and it's important to understand the rates and terms they provide. By setting royalties, you can calculate and predict your earnings from each sale.

;

;You may also want to consider offering your ebook for free.

;

;Although it wouldn't help generate direct revenue for your company, it can still enhance exposure and attract a larger readership, leading to word-of-mouth promotion and potentially increasing future sales. Plus, it provides an opportunity to generate leads and build an email list for future engagement.

;

;5. Preview and Publish

;

;Before publishing, preview your ebook to ensure it looks as intended and ensure there are no errors or formatting issues. Once you're satisfied, click the publish button to make your ebook available for purchase.

;

;Keep in mind that the steps mentioned above are general guidelines, and the specific uploading process may vary based on the platform you choose to publish your ebook with.

; ;;

;Ebook Ideas

;

;So, what should you write about in your ebook? I'll answer that question with another question: What do you want your readers to get out of this ebook? To identify an ebook idea that suits your audience, consider the type of ebook you're trying to create. Here are a few ideas.

;

;New Research

;

;Conducting an experiment or business survey? This is a great way to develop proprietary knowledge and become a thought leader in your industry. But how will you share your findings with the people who care about it? ;Create an ebook; that describes the experiment, what you intended to find out, the results of the experiment, and what these findings mean for your readers and the market at large.

;

;Case Study

;

;People love success stories, especially if these people are on the fence about purchasing something from you. If you have a client whose business you're particularly proud to have, why not tell their story in an ebook?

;

;Ebook case studies show your buyers that other people trust you and have benefited from your product or service. In your ebook, describe what your client's challenge was, how you connected with them, and how you were able to help your client solve their challenge and become successful.

;

;Product Demo

;

;The more complex your product is, the more information your customers will need to use it correctly. If your product or service has many use cases or it's hard to set up alone, dedicate a brief ebook to showing people how to make the most out of it.

;

;For instance, in the first section of your ebook, you can explain how to launch your product or service. The second section can break down the individual features and purposes your product is best used for.

;

;Interview

;

;Are you interested in interviewing a well-known person in your market? Perhaps you've already sat down with an influencer to pick their brain about the industry's future. Package this interview into an ebook, making it easy for your customers to read and share your inside scoop.

;

;Playbook

;

;A “playbook” is a document people can use when taking on a new project or concept that is foreign to them. Think of it like a cheat sheet, full of tips and tricks that help your customers get better at what they do.

;

;When done right, a playbook equips your customers with the information they would need to excel when using your product. For example, a software vendor for IT professionals might create a “virus protection playbook” that makes support teams better at preventing viruses for their respective companies.

;

;Blog Post Series

;

;Sometimes, the best ebook for your business is already strewn across ;a series of blog posts;. If you've spent the last month writing articles all on the same subject for your business, imagine how these posts would look stitched together?

;

;Each article can begin a new chapter. Then, once this ebook is created, you can promote it on a landing page, link to this landing page from each blog post, and generate leads from readers who want to download the entire blog series in one convenient ebook.

; ;;

;Ebook FAQs

;

;Are ebooks profitable?

;

;Yes, they can be.

;

;Ebooks are high-volume, low-sales-price offers. This means you'll need to sell many of them at a relatively low price point to compete in the market and turn a significant profit. Depending on your industry, ebooks can range from free to more than $100.

;

;Before ;setting a price for your ebook;, do some research. Determine who your audience is, what they're willing to pay, and how many people within your target market might be ready to buy it. Then, determine the platforms you'll sell your ebook through. Amazon? Apple Books? Your website? You can research how much ebooks usually go for on these sites and incorporate this insight into your ;pricing strategy;.

;

;How is an ebook structured?

;

;There's no set rule for organizing your content into an ebook. It generally mimics the structure of a novel or textbook (depending on what it is you're writing about). But, you should be sure to adhere to some aspects of an ebook.

;

;Ebooks typically have a system of chapters and supporting images. Like a blog post, they also do well when further segmenting their text with subheaders that break down the discussion into specific sections. If you're writing about professional sports, for example, and one of your chapters is about Major League Baseball (MLB) in the US, you might want to establish subchapters about the various teams belonging to the MLB.

;

;What can an ebook be about?

;

;Anything. Well, within reason.

;

;Ebooks are simply a marketer's way of delivering lots of critical information in a form their potential customers are most willing to read.

;

;For example, an environmental company might write an ebook about water conservation. They might also focus an ebook entirely on using their water-saving product or how it helped a customer solve a problem.

;

;Research is a significant part of ebook creation, no matter your ebook's topic. Contrary to short-form content like articles and videos, the content of an ebook is predicated on trust and evidence. A user who obtains (or requests access to) your ebook wants the full story, not just the bullet points. That includes all the content and testing you went through to produce the ebook.

;

;Can you edit an ebook?

;

;Nope.

;

;An ebook can't be edited once it's been saved in one of the ;major file formats;, so it's best to ensure you have an editable version saved in a program like Microsoft Word.

;

;But why would you want your ebook to be uneditable? Making ebooks uneditable ensures the content remains unchanged — both the format and the information — as it's shared between multiple users.

;

;You can edit ebooks if they're saved using an editable PDF, a feature that is specific to Adobe Acrobat. If you have the software, learning ;how to edit PDFs; is simple with Acrobat's user-friendly interface.

;

;How do you read an ebook?

;

;You can read an ebook on many different devices: iPhone, Android smartphones, a Macbook, PC, and e-readers such as the Nook and Kindle. The latter two devices are typically used to read novels in digital form. Nook and Kindle owners can store thousands of books (literally) on a single Nook or Kindle.

;

;Share Your Expertise in an Ebook

;

;Ebooks are one of the top converting lead magnets a business can offer to its audience. Creating an ebook is all about delivering high value at a low price point to generate a high sales volume.

;

;Ebooks work well for new businesses looking for brand awareness and established companies securing a spot as an industry thought leader.

;

;So long as you and your team have outlined what success looks like for your ebook launch, you'll reap the rewards of this stand-alone asset for months — or even years — to come. So get started on your ebook using the free template available in the offer below.

;In 2007, the world was introduced to Tumblr, a blogging site where users could post almost anything from fashion inspo to personal writing to GIFS, art, and more. 

;

;Since then, countless other social media websites have risen and fallen, but Tumblr is still going strong after over 15 years. 

;

;So, what's the key to Tumblr's longevity? Community. Tumblr has the unique position of being a platform where various ;fandoms; can gather virtually and discuss topics both new and old. 

;

;According to Forbes, ;66% of companies; say their community impacts customer retention. Furthermore, ;90% of social media marketers; say building an active online community is critical to success.

;

;So, how do you build a community around your own brand? Fortunately, I spoke to Tumblr Chief Marketing Officer Matthew Ryan to get some tips.

;

;;;;

;

;How to Foster Community Around Your Brand

;

;As I said, community is the backbone of Tumblr's longevity as a social media platform, so it's no suppose Ryan was able to drop excellent gems of advice.

;

;Know What Makes Your Brand Special

;

;Anyone familiar with Tumblr will tell you there are few online platforms like it. Over the years, Tumblr has become a haven for fans of different aspects of pop culture, such as comics, anime, film, and television.

;

;Ryan says the team behind Tumblr doesn't shy away from the site's association with fandoms and enthusiasts.

;

;"We lean toward two brand tenets," he explains. "The first one is fandom; we're a great place for fans to ;really ;go deep into their particular fandom of choice."

;

;The CMO says other platforms are places where fans may go to give live reactions to their favorite series, but Tumblr is where fandoms live long after a series wraps.

;

;"A lot of places like X serve as real-time destinations where you might go if the movie just premiered or the season finale just dropped, but that kind of long-tail of fandom is where Tumblr thrives," he says.

;

;;;;Image Source;;

;

;Ryan says this is partly due to Tumblr's unique position as a social media platform that isn't heavily driven by algorithms. Moreover, Ryan says the site is a "blank" platform that allows users to post any media type they want.

;

;"Our users have the ability to create or produce their art and their stories around characters and plots they find compelling," he explains. "Fandom is a big source of our creativity and life on the platform."

;

;Tumblr's versatility brings us to Tumblr's second tenet.

;

;"The other brand tenet is being a great place for art and artists," Ryan says. "We are a blank platform and one of the only platforms that still allows all media types and has done so since the inception of Tumblr … That gives artists, especially, a ton of freedom."

;

;;;;Image Source;;

;

;So, lean into what makes your brand unique, whether it's your audience, the type of services and products you provide, or something else.

;

;Pay Attention to Your Audience

;

;"We genuinely try to listen to what they need, what they want, what they're doing on the platform and deliver back the right kind of services and content they're asking for," Ryan explains.

;

;Ryan recalls a recent trend in which a Tumblr user claimed "anything" can trend on the platform. The user then put two random words together in a post and encouraged other users to make the phrase go viral on Tumblr.

;

;The random words were "mole" and "interest," and, sure enough, "mole interest" became a Tumblr trending topic.

;

;"'Mole interest' became a meme and trended at number one. We wrote a feature on it the next day on our Today Tab. It got a whole life of its own."

;

;;;;Image Source;;

;

;As Ryan said before, Tumblr is also a popular space for artists, so it's no surprise the platform started a trend that appeals to the creative side of its consumers.

;

;"We did a campaign last year called Build-A-Beast, where we gave people weekly prompts around Halloween of a monster they could create," he recalls. "It was written prompts, and users could respond with art matching the prompt."

;

;Sure enough, the trend took off, and artists eagerly shared their creations all October long.

;

;To stay on top of the interests of Tumblr users, Ryan says the platform has an editorial team and staff dedicated to writing content wrap-ups and implementing social listening to stay in the know of user trends and hot topics.

;

;Consider a similar approach for your own brand and craft a team that is dedicated to tracking and reporting topics and discussions happening within your brand's community.

;

;"Then you can see where trends are going," Ryan advises.

;

;Leverage Segmentation

;

;Another key to building and maintaining a community around your brand is segmentation, according to Ryan. And that's where HubSpot comes in.

;

;"We use HubSpot to deliver a lot of content to lapsed users," he explains. "We use a lot of heavy segmentation as far as tracking what lapsed users used to do on the platform, what they're interested in, and the signals they've given us."

;

;Ryan says that information is then used to deliver hyper-relevant messaging to those users to revive their interest in Tumblr.

;

;"So, we find people are interested in past memes that are similar and have a slightly animal tone to them," he says, "we'll send mole interest to those users, and hopefully they'll reactivate and be interested in the platform again."

;

;Be Transparent

;

;Trust is crucial to community-building and to maintaining consumers. In fact, ;80% of consumers ;consider trust a deciding factor in their buying decisions. One way to build trust is to be transparent.

;

;Ryan says Staff.Tumblr is a major blog every user follows by default, and it's where the platform communicates any changes coming to the site.

;

;Other blogs used to keep Tumblr consumers informed is Changes.Tumblr and WIP.Tumblr (WIP meaning “Work in Progress”).

;

;"All of these dedicated blogs talk about a lot of the work that we're doing and we're publishing," Ryan says. "My advice is to be as transparent as you can and listen to every metric that's coming back to your team."

;

;In short, if you want to build a thriving, long-lasting community of consumers around your brand, keep in tune with who your consumers are and what they care about.

;

;You also need to lean into the unique strengths and features of your brand, product, or service.

;

;Finally, you must be transparent and build trust with your consumers by keeping them in the loop of any major changes and being open to feedback.

;How Do Consumers Want to Learn About Products in 2023?

;

;Consumers are discovering products and their features through a variety of channels and maintain the same preferences as they did in 2022: surfing the web, retail stores, then social media and television ads. 

; ;;;

;While ads on streaming services and marketing emails are less popular among all generations combined, splitting data up by age group paints a different picture. 

;

;Gen Z, Millennials, and Gen X set themselves apart from Boomers in their preference for learning about products through social media, with Boomers preferring to search the internet. Gen Z and Boomers align on their interest in word-of-mouth for product discovery. 

;

;;;;

;

;So let's dive deeper into the most popular channels consumers use to learn about products.

;

;SEO is Key for Product Discovery

;

;34% of consumers prefer to learn about products by searching the internet, highlighting the importance of ;optimizing;; your website for SEO;.

;

;It's popular among all age groups, but the generational difference makes it most popular among Gen X and Boomers. This doesn't mean search engines are dying, though. Consumers say search engines are ;;still the best way to get information;;. 

; ;;;

;Since we know consumers are searching the web to better understand products and their features, it's also key to get a sense; ;of which devices they are using to create the best user experience.;;;

;

;Not only are mobile phones the device of choice for over 50% of consumers when searching up a question online, but they are also the most used device when they shop online.

; ;;;

;;The use of mobile devices is significantly higher for all generations (except for Boomers), meaning you should optimize your website to be mobile-firs;t.

; ;;;

;Retail Is Still Relevant, Especially for Older Generations

;

;Coming in second place, 28% of consumers say they prefer to learn about products in retail stores. Unsurprisingly, the in-person approach is most popular among older age groups, though it isn't completely lost on Gen Z and is still favored by almost one in five Millennials.

; ;

;Social media is the future of shopping. 

;

;In the past three months, ;;41%;; of consumers have discovered a product on social media. When we split this up by age group, 64% of Gen Z have discovered products on social media in the past three months. 

;

;;;;

;

;63% and 56% of consumers have used Facebook and Instagram, respectively, to make an in-app purchase in the past three months. That's a +14% increase for Facebook and +27% for Instagram just from January of 2023, only symbolizing steady growth of social commerce among consumers. 

;

;Next, let's take a look at how consumers want to learn about products on social media.

;

;;;;

;

;Consumers prefer to discover products on social media through ads or sponsored content, short-form videos, and through feed posts and social media marketplaces with off-app purchases tied for third place. 

;

;The top preference for ads or sponsored content remains consistent from 2022, but there were two notable YoY changes. Consumers in 2023 have a greater preference for short-form video, a +23% YoY increase/percent change, and influencer marketing saw a +15% YoY increase. 

;

;;;;

;

;Generationally, influencers are still popular sources of product discovery for Gen Z. 

;

;;;;

;

;You might also be wondering what kind of content consumers want to see from brands on social media.

;

;;;;

;

;44% of consumers say relatable content is the most memorable, followed by content showcasing a brand's products/services (demos, teasers, etc.), then funny content. 

;

;The top three preferences were the same in 2022 but in different spots. Funny content was the most memorable but experienced a -29% YoY drop. Relatable content rose to the top spot with a +4.7% YoY change. 

;

;;;;

;

;TV Ads Are Key for Boomers and Gen X

;

;TV ads are key for Baby Boomers, and it's their second preferred way to discover new products. The channel falls short for all other generations, however. 

; ;

;Word of Mouth Is Relevant, But Gen Z and Gen X Appreciate Influencers

;

;26% of consumers say they prefer to learn about products through word of mouth, and it ranks in the top 5 channels for learning about products for every generation. It takes up the third spot for Gen Z and Gen X. 

;

;YouTube Ads are Key For Gen Z and Millennials

;

;Overall, just 16% of consumers say they prefer learning about a product and its features through YouTube ads, but the video platform ranks among the top channels for Gen Z and Millennials.
